title: The Socialist Myth of Economic Monopoly Iakovos Alhadeff
description: In this essay I explain why economic monopolies are never a consequence of free markets but rather a consequence of government regulation. I examine both the Marxist approach to monopolies and the neoclassical competition and monopolistic theory. I have postgraduate studies in economics, but I am not a specialist, and this is a document for the general reader with no economic knowledge. English is not my first language so please excuse my syntax.
